5#ifndef V8_INIT_ISOLATE_GROUP_H_
6#define V8_INIT_ISOLATE_GROUP_H_
7
8#include <memory>
9
10#include "src/base/page-allocator.h"
11#include "src/common/globals.h"
12#include "src/flags/flags.h"
13#include "src/utils/allocation.h"
14
15namespace v8 {
16
17namespace base {
18template <typename T>
19class LeakyObject;
20} // namespace base
21
22namespace internal {
23
24// An IsolateGroup allows an API user to control which isolates get allocated
25// together in a shared pointer cage.
26//
27// The standard configuration of V8 is to enable pointer compression and to
28// allocate all isolates in a single shared pointer cage
29// (V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_IN_SHARED_CAGE). This also enables the sandbox
30// (V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX), of which there can currently be only one per process, as
31// it requires a large part of the virtual address space.
32//
33// The standard configuration comes with a limitation, in that the total size of
34// the compressed pointer cage is limited to 4 GB. Some API users would like
35// pointer compression but also want to avoid the 4 GB limit of the shared
36// pointer cage. Isolate groups allow users to declare which isolates should be
37// co-located in a single pointer cage.
38//
39// Isolate groups are useful only if pointer compression is enabled. Otherwise,
40// the isolate could just allocate pages from the global system allocator;
41// there's no need to stay within any particular address range. If pointer
42// compression is disabled, isolate groups are a no-op.
43//
44// Note that JavaScript objects can only be passed between isolates of the same
45// group. Ensuring this invariant is the responsibility of the API user.
46class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE IsolateGroup final {
47 public:
48 // Create a new isolate group, allocating a fresh pointer cage if pointer
49 // compression is enabled.
50 //
51 // The pointer cage for isolates in this group will be released when the
52 // group's refcount drops to zero. The group's initial refcount is 1.
53 //
54 // Note that if pointer compression is disabled, isolates are not grouped and
55 // no memory is associated with the isolate group.
56 static IsolateGroup* New();
57
58 // Some configurations (e.g. V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX) put all isolates into a single
59 // group. InitializeOncePerProcess should be called early on to initialize
60 // the process-wide group. If this configuration has no process-wide isolate
61 // group, the result is nullptr.
62 static IsolateGroup* AcquireGlobal();
63
64 static void InitializeOncePerProcess();
65
66 // Obtain a fresh reference on the isolate group.
67 IsolateGroup* Acquire() {
68 DCHECK_LT(0, reference_count_.load());
69 reference_count_++;
70 return this;
71 }
72
73 // Release a reference on an isolate group, possibly freeing any shared memory
74 // resources.
75 void Release() {
76 DCHECK_LT(0, reference_count_.load());
77 if (--reference_count_ == 0) delete this;
78 }
79
80 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator() const { return page_allocator_; }
81
82 VirtualMemoryCage* GetPtrComprCage() const {
83 return pointer_compression_cage_;
84 }
85 VirtualMemoryCage* GetTrustedPtrComprCage() const {
86 return trusted_pointer_compression_cage_;
87 }
88
89 Address GetPtrComprCageBase() const { return GetPtrComprCage()->base(); }
90 Address GetTrustedPtrComprCageBase() const {
91 return GetTrustedPtrComprCage()->base();
92 }
93
94 private:
95 friend class ::v8::base::LeakyObject<IsolateGroup>;
96 static IsolateGroup* GetProcessWideIsolateGroup();
97
98 IsolateGroup() {}
99 ~IsolateGroup() { DCHECK_EQ(reference_count_.load(), 0); }
100 IsolateGroup(const IsolateGroup&) = delete;
101 IsolateGroup& operator=(const IsolateGroup&) = delete;
102
103 friend class PoolTest;
104 // Only used for testing.
105 static void ReleaseGlobal();
106
107 std::atomic<int> reference_count_{1};
108 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator_ = nullptr;
109 VirtualMemoryCage* trusted_pointer_compression_cage_ = nullptr;
110 VirtualMemoryCage* pointer_compression_cage_ = nullptr;
111 VirtualMemoryCage reservation_;
112};
113
114} // namespace internal
115} // namespace v8
116
117#endif // V8_INIT_ISOLATE_GROUP_H_
